definition: Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings)
variant of 克[ke4]/to subdue/to overthrow/to restrain
Ke (c. 2000 BC), seventh of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia

sentences.english: You should try that Thai restaurant on Nicolson Street.
sentences.chinese: 你应该去尼克森街那家泰式料理吃吃看。

sentences.english: Lt. Nixon thinks this is a can of peaches.
sentences.chinese: 尼克森少尉认为这是一罐桃子。

sentences.english: US ex-president Nixon's comeback is placed at sixth.
sentences.chinese: 美国前总统尼克森的复出被评为第六大经典假新闻。

sentences.english: Mcgovern started to run against nixon.
sentences.chinese: 麦戈文开始与尼克森竞选。

sentences.english: Nixon used a slush fund to finance spy on the democrats.
sentences.chinese: 尼克森用行贿基金支付监视民主党活动的款项。

sentences.english: Remember the story about the 1960 Nixon-Kennedy debate?
sentences.chinese: 还记得1960年尼克森与甘迺迪的那场辩论赛吗？

definition: Bush (name)/George H.W. Bush (1924-2018), US president 1988-1992/George W. Bush (1946-), US President 2000-2008
Paulson or Powellson (name)/Henry (Hank) Paulson (1946-), US banker, US Treasury Secretary from 2006
Kennedy (name)/J.F. Kennedy (1917-1963), US Democrat politician, president 1961-1963
Cheney (name)/Richard B. "Dick" Cheney (1941-), US Republican politician, vice-president 2001-2008
O'Connor (name)/Thomas Power O'Connor (1848-1929), Irish journalist and nationalist political leader
Hoover (name)/Herbert Hoover (1874-1964) US mining engineer and Republican politician, president (1929-1933)
